Name: Apricot
Composition: Vitamins: A (beta-carotene), C, E, K,  B-group vitamins (B1, B2, B6,folic acid). Minerals: Potassium, calcium, magnesium, iron, phosphorus. Others: Fiber, natural sugars (glucose, fructose, sucrose), antioxidants (flavonoids, carotenoids). Calories: Fresh apricot – 100 g ≈  45–50 kcal; Dried apricot – 100 g ≈ 200–250 kcal.
Benefits: Eye health: Beta-carotene (vitamin A) st Cardiovascular system: Potassium regulates heart rhythm and balances blood pressure.
Blood circulation: Iron prevents anemia  and supports hemoglobin.
Digestive system: Fiber cleanses intestines and relieves constipation.
Skin and hair: Antioxidants protect skin from aging and strengthen hair roots.
Immunity: Vitamin C boosts the body’s resistance.
Bone health: Calcium and magnesium strengthen bones
